titlestmt.subtitle: A Finding Aid to the Robert Dennis Reid Papers, 1961-1977 , in the Archives of American Art
titlestmt.author: by Jayna M. Hanson

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Jayna Hanson on August 18, 2008

did.head: Collection Overview

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution

did.abstract: This small collection of papers of African-American artist and educator Robert Dennis Reid consists primarily of correspondence (75 items), and scattered exhibition catalogs and announcements, clippings, and photographs and slides of Reid's artwork. There is also one photograph of Reid. Within the correspondence are six letters from Romare Bearden.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: Robert Dennis Reid donated his papers to the Archives of American Art on November 4, 1974.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed by Jayna Hanson in 2008.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Robert Dennis Reid papers, 1961-1977. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research. Use requires an appointment.

userestrict.head: Ownership and Literary Rights
userestrict.p: The Robert Dennis Reid papers are owned by the Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution. Literary rights as possessed by the donor have been dedicated to public use for research, study, and scholarship. The collection is subject to all copyright laws.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: African-American painter and fine arts professor Robert Dennis Reid was born in Atlanta, Georgia in 1924. He studied at Clark College in Atlanta from 1941-1943 and continued his art education at the Art Institute of Chicago. Later, Reid studied at the Parsons New School of Design in New York City.

Throughout his career, Reid exhibitied at Grand Central Art Gallery in New York City, the UCLA Gallery, and the Whitney Museum of American Art. In addition, the 1st World Festival of Negro Artists in Dakar, Senegal (1965) featured Reid's work. Reid held positions as a professor of painting and drawing at the Summit Art Center in New Jersey and the Rhode Island School of Design. He also exhibited with the U.S. State Department in the "Arts in the American Embassies" program. To supplement his income, Reid worked for the United States Post Office in the evenings. Robert Dennis Reid died in 2002.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This small collection of papers of African-American painter and fine arts professor Robert Dennis Reid consists of a resume, 75 letters to and from Reid, scattered exhibition catalogs and announcements, clippings, and photographs and slides of Reid's artwork. There is also one photograph of Reid. Within the correspondence are six letters from Romare Bearden, as well as correspondence with Grand Central Modern Gallery, Grand Central Galleries, University of Notre Dame Art Gallery, Fairweather Hardin Gallery (Chicago), Rose Fried Gallery, Galerie Darthea Speyer (Paris), Benson Gallery, ADI Gallery, Inc. (San Francisco, Calif.), and the Young Gallery (Calif.).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into 4 series:

controlaccess.head: Names and Subject Terms
controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed in the online catalog of the Archives of American Art under the following terms:

controlaccess.head: Subjects-Topical:
controlaccess.subject: Art teachers -- New York (State)-- New York
Art galleries, Commercial
Painters -- New York (State) -- New York

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: University of Notre Dame Art Gallery

scopecontent.p: This series consists of one resume of Robert Dennis Reid.

Found here is correspondence to and from Robert Dennis Reid, including six letters from Romare Bearden and correspondence with Grand Central Modern Gallery, Grand Central Galleries, University of Notre Dame Art Gallery, Fairweather Hardin Gallery (Chicago), Rose Fried Gallery, Galerie Darthea Speyer (Paris), Benson Gallery, ADI Gallery, Inc. (San Francisco, Calif.), and the Young Gallery (Calif.)

arrangement.p: Correspondence is arranged chronologically with undated materials at the end.

scopecontent.p: This series contains exhibtion announcements, catalogs, press releases and newspaper clippings concerning Robert Dennis Reid's shows and activities as an artist.
This series consists of one photograph of Robert Dennis Reid as well as slides and photographs of his works of art.
